thread.title: 7 Simple Ways To Eat Healthier In The New Year
thread.title_full: 7 Simple Ways To Eat Healthier In The New Year

author: Melissa Harrison
title: 7 Simple Ways To Eat Healthier In The New Year
text:
View this image ›
gimmesomeoven.com Then make a big batch on Sunday for easy, grab-and-go lean protein that you can add to salads or stuff into pitas throughout the week. These can go from prep to plate in about 30 minutes.
More: How To Make Oven-Baked Chicken Breasts
ID: 10278423 2. Snack smarter with better-for-you options that you can keep at your desk. View this image ›
Jenny Chang / BuzzFeed Prepacked snacks FTW.
More: 21 Healthyish Prepackaged Snacks That Actually Taste Good
ID: 10277889 3. Swap the occasional soda for iced tea instead. Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @melissaharrison You can even brew your own with an at-home teamaker . Not a fan of the unsweetened stuff? Add lemons, limes, or even muddled berries for added flavor — or experiment with fun tea flavors like super fruit or licorice & mint .
ID: 10284421 4. Pick one Saturday a month and have a healthy date night dinner. View this image ›
Charlotte Gomez / BuzzFeed Or a BFF dinner, or a solo Netflix dinner-plus-leftovers. IT’S ALL GOOD.
More : 21 Healthy Dinner Recipes For Two People
ID: 10277911 5. For an easy, protein-packed dip, mix Greek yogurt with almond butter, cinnamon, and a bit of honey. View this image ›
inkatrinaskitchen.com This would go great with apples, or for something sweet-and-savory, pretzel sticks. Find the dip recipe here .
More: 21 Healthy Snacks For When You’re Trying to Lose Weight
ID: 10278546 6. Braise or poach fish instead of frying it. View this image ›
nutritionistinthekitch.com Cooking the fish in liquid means that you don’t have to add any extra calories or fat in the form of oil — and the fish will still retain a ton of flavor. Find the recipe for ginger-soy poached salmon at Nutritionist in the Kitch .
More: 21 Easy, Healthy Cooking Tips For The New Year
ID: 10278377 7. Ditch booze loaded with sugary mixers, and sweeten cocktails with fruit instead. View this image ›
thealmondeater.com Here’s a list of lighter cocktails that don’t require a ton of sugar-heavy mixers. Cheers!
More: 14 Fun Cocktails That Actually Aren’t That Bad For You
ID: 10278483
